scenario:
Ares Capital (ARCC) is the highest-yielding individual stock in the portfolio with a forward dividend yield of 8.12%, expected to generate around $1,843 in income this year. The company is a business development company (BDC) that returns at least 90% of profits to shareholders in the form of dividends, exempt from federal income taxes. Ares Capital has a diversified portfolio and a solid balance sheet, with a total addressable market of around $5.4 trillion.

Two midstream energy stocks, Energy Transfer (ET) and Enterprise Products Partners (EPD), are expected to generate at least $2,975 in total distributions this year, with Enterprise Products Partners having a higher forward distribution yield of 6.46%. Energy Transfer operates over 130,000 miles of pipeline and expects to grow its distribution by 3% to 5% annually.

Other high-yield dividend stocks include Brookfield Infrastructure Partners (BIP) with a yield of 4.82%, expected to generate around $1,142 in distribution income this year, and Dominion Energy (D) with a yield of 4.8%, expected to generate around $977 in dividend income this year. The total expected passive income from these five stocks in 2025 is $6,937.
